entries: Aven are inclined toward the lawful good alignment of the Church of Serra

entries.name: Hawkeyed
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill. In addition, attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged weapon attack rolls.

entries.name: 年齡
entries: Khenra mature quickly, reaching adulthood in their early teens. Khenra initiates are usually the youngest in a crop, completing the trials by their late teens. Even without a violent death, they rarely live past 60.

entries.name: 陣營
entries: Most khenra lean toward chaotic alignments. They have no particular inclination toward good or evil.

entries.name: 體型
entries: Khenra have similar builds to humans. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Khenra Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency with the khopesh (longsword), spear, and javelin.

entries.name: Khenra Twins.
entries: If your twin is alive and you can see your twin, whenever you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll. If your twin is dead (or if you were born without a twin), you can't be {@condition frightened}.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Khenra.

entries.name: 年齡
entries: Minotaurs develop more slowly than humans, reaching full maturity around the age of 20. They typically become acolytes at around 8 or 9 years old, making them among the older members of their crops. Once they reach maturity, though, minotaurs age quickly, rushing headlong through the trials (as they do all aspects of life) to complete them before they pass their peak. A minotaur allowed to die of old age would rarely live beyond 40.

entries.name: 陣營
entries: Most minotaurs lean toward chaotic alignments, and they have a slight inclination toward evil.

entries.name: 體型
entries: Minotaurs average over 6 feet in height, and they have strong, stocky builds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Natural Weapon
entries: You can use your horns as a natural weapon to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with your horns, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier.

entries.name: Menacing
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Intimidation} skill.

entries.name: Relentless Endurance
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Savage Attacks
entries: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Minotaur.

entries.name: 年齡
entries: Like humans, naga reach adulthood in their late teens. They show no signs of aging beyond that point except for growing larger, so in theory, a naga could live well over a century.

entries.name: 陣營
entries: Most naga are either neutral or neutral evil in alignment.

entries.name: 體型
entries: Naga stand about 5 feet tall when upright, but the total length of their bodies, head to tail, ranges from 10 to as much as 20 feet. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed Burst
entries: By lowering your body to the ground and propelling yourself with your arms, you can move more quickly for a time. As a bonus action on your turn, if you have both hands free, you can increase your walking speed by 5 feet until the end of your turn.

entries.name: Natural Weapons
entries: Your fanged maw and constricting serpentine body are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes.

If you hit with your bite, you deal piercing damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength modifier, and your target must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). On a failed save, the target takes 1d4 poison damage.

If you hit with your constrict attack, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and you can't constrict another target.

entries.name: Poison Immunity
entries: You are immune to poison damage and can't be {@condition poisoned}.

entries.name: Poison Affinity
entries: You gain proficiency with the {@item poisoner's kit|phb}.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Naga.

entries.name: 年齡
entries: Gith reach adulthood in their late teens and live for about a century.

entries.name: 體型
entries: Gith are taller and leaner than humans, with most a slender 6 feet in height.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Gith.

entries.name: 陣營
entries: Githyanki tend toward lawful evil. They are self-centered, violent, and arrogant, yet they remain the faithful servants of their lich-queen, Vlaakith. Renegade githyanki tend toward chaos as they have forsaken her will.

entries.name: Decadent Mastery
entries: You learn one language of your choice, and you are proficient with one skill or tool of your choice. In the timeless city of Tu'narath, githyanki have bountiful time to master odd bits of knowledge.

entries.name: Martial Prodigy
entries: You are proficient with light and medium armor. Your people are ever ready for war.

entries.name: Githyanki Psionics
entries: You know the {@spell mage hand} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast {@spell jump} once with this trait, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell 迷蹤步} spell once with this trait, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.
Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells. You can cast all of them without components.

entries.name: 陣營
entries: Githzerai tend toward lawful neutral. Their rigorous training in psychic abilities requires an implacable mental discipline.

entries.name: Monastic Training
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC while you aren't wearing medium or heavy armor and aren't using a shield. All githzerai receive basic training from monks, and the monks among them are unmatched in their defensive abilities.

entries.name: Githzerai Psionics
entries: You know the {@spell mage hand} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast {@spell shield} once with this trait, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell detect thoughts} spell once with this trait, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.
Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells. You can cast all of them without components.

entries.name: 年齡
entries: Gith reach adulthood in their late teens and live for about a century.

entries.name: 體型
entries: Gith are taller and leaner than humans, with most a slender 6 feet in height.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Gith.

entries.name: 陣營
entries: Githyanki tend toward lawful evil. They are aggressive and arrogant, and they remain the faithful servants of their lich-queen, Vlaakith. Renegade githyanki tend toward chaos.

entries.name: Decadent Mastery
entries: You learn one language of your choice, and you are proficient with one skill or tool of your choice. In the timeless city of Tu'narath, githyanki have bountiful time to master odd bits of knowledge.

entries.name: Martial Prodigy
entries: You are proficient with light and medium armor and with shortswords, longswords, and greatswords.

entries.name: Githyanki Psionics
entries: You know the {@spell mage hand} cantrip, and the hand is invisible when you cast the cantrip with this trait.

When you reach 3rd level, you can cast {@spell jump} once with this trait, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell misty step} spell once with this trait, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.
Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells. When you cast them with this trait, they don't require components.

entries.name: 陣營
entries: Githzerai tend toward lawful neutral. Their rigorous training in psychic abilities requires an implacable mental discipline.

entries.name: Mental Discipline
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against the {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened} conditions. Under the tutelage of monastic masters, githzerai learn to govern their own minds.

entries.name: Githzerai Psionics
entries: You know the {@spell mage hand} cantrip, and the hand is invisible when you cast the cantrip with this trait.

When you reach 3rd level, you can cast {@spell shield} once with this trait, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell detect thoughts} spell once with this trait, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.
Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells. When you cast them with this trait, they don't require components.

entries.name: 年齡
entries: Young tortles crawl for a few weeks after birth before learning to walk on two legs. They reach adulthood by the age of 15 and live an average of 50 years.

entries.name: 陣營
entries: Tortles tend to lead orderly, ritualistic lives. They develop customs and routines, becoming more set in their ways as they age. Most are lawful good. A few can be selfish and greedy, tending more toward evil, but it's unusual for a tortle to shuck off order in favor of chaos.

entries.name: 體型
entries: Tortle adults stand 5 to 6 feet tall and average 450 pounds. Their shells account for roughly one-third of their weight. Your size is Medium

entries.name: Claws
entries: Your claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength modifier, instead of bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries: You can hold your breath for up to 1 hour at a time. Tortles aren't natural swimmers, but they can remain underwater for some time before needing to come up for air.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: Due to your shell and the shape of your body, you are ill-suited to wearing armor. Your shell provides ample protection, however; it gives you a base AC of 17 (your Dexterity modifier doesn't affect this number). You gain no benefit from wearing armor, but if you are using a shield, you can apply the shield's bonus as normal.

entries.name: Shell Defense
entries: You can withdraw into your shell as an action. until you emerge, you gain a +4 bonus to AC, and you have advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws. While in your shell, you are {@condition prone}, your speed is 0 and can't increase, you have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, you can't take reactions, and the only action you can take is a bonus action to emerge from your shell.

entries.name: Survival Instinct
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Survival} skill. Tortles have finely honed survival instincts.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Aquan and Common.

entries.name: 年齡
entries: Grungs mature to adulthood in a single year, but have been known to live up to 50 years.

entries.name: 陣營
entries: Most grungs are lawful, having been raised in a strict caste system. They tend toward evil as well, coming from a culture where social advancement occurs rarely, and most often because another member of your army has died and there is no one else of that caste to fill the vacancy.

entries.name: 體型
entries: Grungs stand between 2 ½ and 3 ½ feet tall and average about 30 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Arboreal Alertness
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Poison Immunity
entries: You're immune to poison damage and the {@condition poisoned} condition.

entries.name: Poisonous Skin
entries: Any creature that grapples you or otherwise comes into direct contact with your skin must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A {@condition poisoned} creature no longer in direct contact with you can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

You can also apply this poison to any piercing weapon as part of an attack with that weapon, though when you hit the poison reacts differently. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or take 2d4 poison damage.

entries.name: Standing Leap
entries: Your long jump is up to 25 feet and your high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

entries.name: Water Dependency
entries: If you fail to immerse yourself in water for at least 1 hour during a day, you suffer one level of {@condition exhaustion} at the end of that day. You can only recover from this {@condition exhaustion} through magic or by immersing yourself in water for at least 1 hour.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Grung.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Speak with Frogs and Toads
entries: You can communicate simple concepts to frogs and toads when you speak in Bullywug.

entries.name: Swamp Camouflage
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

entries.name: Standing Leap
entries: Your long jump is up to 20 ft. and your high jump is up to 10 ft., with or without a running start.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Bullywug.

entries.name: Bite
entries: Your fanged maw is a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal piercing damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: 黑暗視覺
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Rampage
entries: When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on your turn, you can take a bonus action to move up to half your speed and make a bite attack.

entries.name: Blindsight
entries: You have no eyes, and cannot be blinded. You can perceive your surroundings within 30 ft., or 10 ft. while deafened. You are considered blind beyond this radius.

entries.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

entries.name: Stone Camouflage
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Undercommon.

entries.name: Martial Advantage
entries: Once per turn, you can deal an extra {@dice 2d6} damage to a creature you hit with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 ft. of an ally of yours that isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: 黑暗視覺
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Goblin.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Otherworldly Perception
entries: You can sense the presence of any creature within 30 feet of you that is {@condition invisible} or on the Ethereal Plane. You can pinpoint such a creature that is moving.

entries.name: Slippery
entries: You have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape a grapple.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, you have disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: 高級黑暗視覺
entries: You have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Undercommon.

entries.name: Brittle Bones
entries: You are vulnerable to bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Undead Nature
entries: You are immune to poison damage and {@condition exhaustion}, and you can't be {@condition poisoned}. You don't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: 黑暗視覺
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can't speak, but you can understand the languages you knew in life.

entries.name: Chameleon Skin
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

entries.name: Stench
entries: Any creature other than a troglodyte that starts its turn within 5 ft. of you must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the stench of all troglodytes for 1 hour.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, you have disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: Your thick hide grants you a +1 bonus to Armor Class.

entries.name: 黑暗視覺
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Troglodyte.

entries.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces you to 0 hit points, you must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5+the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, you drop to 1 hit point instead.

entries.name: Undead Nature
entries: You are immune to poison damage and {@condition exhaustion}, and you can't be {@condition poisoned}. You don't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: 黑暗視覺
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can't speak, but you can understand the languages you knew in life.

entries.name: 年齡
entries: Humans reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: 陣營
entries: Humans tend toward no particular alignment. The best and the worst are found among them.

entries.name: 體型
entries: Humans vary widely in height and build, from barely 5 feet to well over 6 feet tall. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one extra language of your choice. Or, if your campaign uses the optional rules for languages found in the previous section, your national origin determines your native language: Itzocan for the Sun Empire, Coalition pidgin for the Brazen Coalition, or Vampire for the Legion of Dusk. You still speak one additional language of your choice, and Common if it exists in your campaign.

entries.name: 年齡
entries: Vampires don't mature and age in the same way that other races do.

entries.name: 陣營
entries: Vampires might not have an innate tendency toward evil, but many of them end up there. Evil or not, their strict hierarchies incline them toward a lawful alignment.

entries.name: 體型
entries: Vampires are the same size and build as humans. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Bloodthirst
entries: You can drain blood and life energy from a willing creature, or one that is {@condition grappled} by you, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. Make a melee attack against the target. If you hit, you deal 1 piercing damage and 1d6 necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and you regain hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces it's hit point maximum to 0.

entries.name: Feast of Blood
entries: When you drain blood with your Bloodthirst ability, you experience a surge of vitality. Your speed increases by 10 feet, and you gain advantage on Strength and Dexterity checks and saving throws for 1 minute.

entries.name: Vampiric Resistance
entries: You have resistance to necrotic damage.

entries.name: 黑暗視覺
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common (if it exists in your campaign) and Vampire.

entries.name: 年齡
entries: Orcs mature a little faster than humans, reaching adulthood around age 14. They age noticeably faster and rarely live longer than 75 years.

entries.name: 陣營
entries: Most orcs lean toward chaotic alignments, and many serve on pirate ships that encourage an inclination toward evil.

entries.name: 體型
entries: Orcs average over 6 feet in height, and they have strong, stocky builds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Menacing
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Intimidation} skill.

entries.name: Relentless Endurance
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Savage Attacks
entries: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

entries.name: 黑暗視覺
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common (if it exists in your campaign) and Orc.

entries.name: 年齡
entries: Goblins mature faster than humans, reaching adulthood around age 12. They age noticeably faster, and though few goblins live to old age, the most cautious rarely live longer than 50 years.

entries.name: 陣營
entries: Most goblins are wildly chaotic, with no particular inclination toward good or evil but a strong tendency toward mischief.

entries.name: 體型
entries: Goblins average about 3 feet tall and weigh about 40 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Agile Climber
entries: You have a climbing speed of 25 feet. You can't use your climbing speed while you wear medium or heavy armor. (If your campaign uses the variant rule for encumbrance, you can't use your climbing speed if you are encumbered.)

entries.name: 黑暗視覺
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common (if it exists in your campaign) and Goblin.

entries.name: 陣營
entries: 大部分的賽壬傾向混亂陣營，珍惜著因加入海盜團而帶來的自由與獨立。

entries.name: 體型
entries: 賽壬的身高約為5到6呎，但他們的身軀相當纖細，骨頭部分中空以利飛行。你的體型為中型。

entries.name: 賽壬之歌
entries: 你知曉{@spell 交友術}戲法，且施放時無需任何材料構材。

entries.name: 飛行
entries: 你擁有30呎的飛行速度。你不能在穿著中甲或重甲時使用你的飛行速度。（如果你的戰役使用了負重的變體規則，則你不能在你負載時使用你的飛行速度。）

entries.name: 語言
entries: 你可以說、讀、寫通用語（若存在於你的戰役）和賽壬語。

entries.name: 年齡
entries: Merfolk mature at the same rate humans do and reach adulthood around the age of 20. They live considerably longer than humans, though, often reaching well over 100 years.

entries.name: 陣營
entries: Most merfolk are neutral, living in close harmony with nature.

entries.name: 體型
entries: Merfolk are significantly taller than most humans, standing between seven and eight feet tall and averaging about 300 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Swimming
entries: You have a swimming speed of 30 feet.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common (if it exists in your campaign), Merfolk, and one additional language of your choice.

entries.name: Cantrip
entries: You know one cantrip of your choice from the druid spell list. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for it.

entries.name: Mask of the Wild
entries: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

entries.name: Cantrip
entries: You know one cantrip of your choice from the wizard spell list. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.

entries.name: Lore of the Waters
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill History} and {@skill Nature} skills.

entries.name: 年齡
entries: Centaurs mature and age at about the same rate as humans.

entries.name: 陣營
entries: Centaurs are inclined toward neutrality.

entries.name: 體型
entries: Your size is Medium, yet you tower over most other humanoids.

entries.name: Charge
entries: If you move at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hit it with a melee weapon attack on the same turn, roll the weapon's damage dice twice and add them together. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Hooves
entries: Your hooves are natural melee weapons, with which you're proficient. If you hit with a hoof, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier.

entries.name: Equine Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push or drag. In addition, any climb that requires hands and feet is especially difficult for you because of your hooves. When you make such a climb, each foot of movement costs you 4 extra feet, instead of the normal 1 extra foot. Finally, a Medium or smaller creature can ride on your equine back if you allow it. In such a situation, you continue to act independently, not as a controlled mount.

entries.name: Survivor
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Survival} skill.

entries.name: Hybrid Nature
entries: You have two creature types: humanoid and monstrosity. You can be affected by a game effect if it works on either of your creature types.

entries.name: Languages
entries: Languages. You can speak, read, and write Common and Sylvan.

{@note In 2015, minotaurs appeared as a playtest option in Unearthed Arcana. Here is a revised set of traits for minotaur player characters. These traits are suitable for minotaurs on Krynn and in other D&D worlds where these people have avoided the demonic influence of Baphomet.}

entries.name: 年齡
entries: Minotaurs enter adulthood at around the age of 17 and can live up to 150 years.

entries.name: 陣營
entries: Most minotaurs lean toward lawful alignments.

entries.name: 體型
entries: Minotaurs average over 6 feet in height, and they have strong, stocky builds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Horns
entries: Your horns are natural melee weapons, with which you're proficient. When you hit with them, the target takes piercing damage equal to 1d6+your Strength modifier.

entries.name: Goring Rush
entries: Immediately after you use the {@action Dash} action on your turn and move at least as far as your speed, you can make one melee attack with your horns as a bonus action.

entries.name: Hammering Horns
entries: Immediately after you hit a creature with a melee attack as part of the Attack action on your turn, you can attempt to shove that creature with your horns using your reaction. The creature must be no more than one size larger than you and within 5 feet of you. It must make a Strength saving throw against a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier. If it fails, you push it up to 5 feet away from you.

entries.name: Menacing
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Intimidation} skill.

entries.name: Hybrid Nature
entries: You have two creature types: humanoid and monstrosity. You can be affected by a game effect if it works on either of your creature types.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Minotaur.

entries.name: Dive Attack
entries: If you are flying and dive at least 30 ft. straight toward a target and then hit it with a melee weapon attack, the attack deals an extra {@dice 1d6} damage to the target.

entries.name: Talons
entries: You are proficient with your unarmed strikes, which deal 1d4 slashing damage on a hit.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Auran.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries: You have an innate ability to cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

items.name: At will:
items.entry: {@spell nondetection} (self only)

items.name: 1/day each:
items.entry: {@spell blindness/deafness}, {@spell blur}, {@spell disguise self}

entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries: You have an innate ability to cast the following spells.

entries.name: Gnome Cunning
entries: You have advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

entries.name: 高級黑暗視覺
entries: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Gnomish, Terran, and Undercommon.

entries.name: Nimble Escape
entries: You can take the {@action Disengage} or {@action Hide} action as a bonus action on each of your turns.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Goblin.

entries.name: Ambusher
entries: In the first round of a combat, you have advantage on attack rolls against any creature who is surprised.

entries.name: Mimicry
entries: You can mimic any sounds you have heard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 14 Wisdom (Insight) check.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can read and write Common and Auran, but you can only speak using your Mimicry trait.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries: You have advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Draconic.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries: You can hold your breath for up to 15 minutes at a time.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: Your scales function as natural armor, granting you a +3 bonus to Armor Class.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Draconic.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Aquan.

entries.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, you can move up to your speed toward a hostile creature that you can see.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Orc.

entries.name: 年齡
entries: Changelings mature slightly faster than humans but share a similar lifespan—typically a century or less. While a changeling can shapeshift to conceal their age, the effects of aging still catch up to them.

entries.name: 陣營
entries: Changelings hate to be bound in any way, and those who follow the path of the Traveler believe that chaos and change are important aspects of life. Most tend toward pragmatic neutrality as opposed to being concerned with lofty ideals. Few changelings embrace evil.

entries.name: 體型
entries: In their natural forms, changelings average between 5 and 6 feet in height, with a slender build. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Change Appearance
entries: As an action, you can transform your appearance or revert to your natural form. You can't duplicate the appearance of a creature you've never seen, and you revert to your natural form if you die.

You decide what you look like, including your height, weight, facial features, the sound of your voice, coloration, hair length, sex, and any other distinguishing characteristics. You can make yourself appear as a member of another race, though none of your game statistics change. You also can't appear as a creature of a different size than you, and your basic shape stays the same; if you're bipedal, you can't use this trait to become quadrupedal, for instance. Your clothing and other equipment don't change in appearance, size, or shape to match your new form, requiring you to keep a few extra outfits on hand to make the most compelling disguise possible.

Even to the most astute observers, your ruse is usually indiscernible. If you rouse suspicion, or if a wary creature suspects something is amiss, you have advantage on any Charisma (Deception) check you make to avoid detection.

entries.name: Changeling Instincts
entries: You gain proficiency with two of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Deception}, {@skill Insight}, {@skill Intimidation}, or {@skill Persuasion}

entries.name: Unsettling Visage
entries: When a creature you can see makes an attack roll against you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the roll. You must use this feature before knowing whether the attack hits or misses. Using this trait reveals your shapeshifting nature to any creature within 30 feet that can see you. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Divergent Persona
entries: You gain proficiency with one tool of your choice. Define a persona associated with that proficiency: establish the name, race, gender, age, and other details. While you are in the form of this persona, the related proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses that proficiency.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and two other languages of your choice.

entries.name: 年齡
entries: Kalashtar develop physically at the same rate as humans do and have similar lifespans.

entries.name: 陣營
entries: The noble spirit tied to a kalashtar drives it toward lawful and good behavior. Most kalashtar combine self-discipline with compassion for all sentient beings, but some kalashtar resist the virtuous influence of their spirit.

entries.name: 體型
entries: Kalashtar are similar in build to humans, though they are typically a few inches taller. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Dual Mind
entries: When you make a Wisdom saving throw, you can use your reaction to gain advantage on the roll. You can use this trait immediately before or after you roll, but before any of the roll's effects occur.

entries.name: Mental Discipline
entries: You have resistance to psychic damage.

entries.name: Mind Link
entries: You can speak telepathically to any creature you can see within 60 feet of you. You don't need to share a language with the creature for it to understand your telepathic messages, but the creature must be able to understand at least one language or be telepathic itself.

As a bonus action when you're speaking telepathically to a creature, you can give that creature the ability to speak telepathically to you until the start of your next turn. To use this ability, the creature must be within 60 feet of you and able to see you.

entries.name: Psychic Glamour
entries: Choose one of the following skills: {@skill Insight}, {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Performance}, or {@skill Persuasion}. You have advantage on all ability checks you make with that skill.

entries.name: Severed from Dreams
entries: Kalashtar sleep, but they don't connect to the plane of dreams as other creatures do. Instead, their minds draw from the memories of their otherworldly spirit while they sleep. As such, you are immune to spells and other magical effects that require you to dream, like the dream spell, but not to spells and effects that put you to sleep, like the sleep spell.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Quori, and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: 年齡
entries: Shifters are quick to mature both physically and emotionally, reaching young adulthood at age 10. They rarely live to be more than 70 years old.

entries.name: 陣營
entries: Shifters tend toward neutrality, being more focused on survival than concepts of good and evil. A love of personal freedom can drive shifters toward chaotic alignments.

entries.name: 體型
entries: Shifters range from 5 to almost 7 feet tall, depending on their subrace. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: 黑暗視覺
entries: You have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have proficiency with the {@skill Perception} skill.

entries.name: Shifting
entries: As a bonus action, you can assume a more bestial appearance. This transformation lasts for 1 minute, until you die, or until you revert to your normal appearance as a bonus action. When you shift, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level + your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 temporary hit point). You also gain additional benefits that depend on your shifter subrace, described below.
Once you shift, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common.

entries.name: Tough
entries: You have proficiency with the {@skill Athletics} skill.

entries.name: Shifting Feature
entries: Whenever you shift, you gain 1d6 additional temporary hit points, and while shifted, you have a +1 bonus to your AC.

entries.name: Fierce
entries: You have proficiency with the {@skill Intimidation} skill.

entries.name: Shifting Feature
entries: While shifted, you can use your elongated fangs to make an unarmed strike as a bonus action. If you hit with your fangs, you can deal piercing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Graceful
entries: You have proficiency with the {@skill Acrobatics} skill.

entries.name: Swift Stride
entries: Your walking speed increases by 5 feet.

entries.name: Shifting Feature
entries: While shifted, your walking speed increases by 5 feet. Additionally, you can move up to 10 feet as a reaction when an enemy ends its turn within 5 feet of you. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

entries.name: Natural Tracker
entries: You have proficiency with the {@skill Survival} skill.

entries.name: Mark the Scent
entries: As a bonus action, you can mark one creature you can see within 10 feet of you. Until the end of your next long rest, your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make to find the marked creature, and you always know the location of that creature if it is within 60 feet of you. You can't use this trait again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Shifting Feature
entries: While shifted, you have advantage on Wisdom checks.

entries.name: 年齡
entries: A typical warforged is between two and thirty years old. The maximum lifespan of the warforged remains a mystery; so far, warforged have shown no signs of deterioration due to age.

entries.name: 陣營
entries: Most warforged take comfort in order and discipline, tending toward law and neutrality, but some have absorbed the morality—or lack thereof—of the beings they served with.

entries.name: 體型
entries: Your size is Medium. Most warforged stand between 5 and 6½ feet tall. Build is affected by your subrace.

entries.name: Warforged Resilience
entries: You were created to have remarkable fortitude, represented by the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}, and you have resistance to poison damage.
You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.
You don't need to sleep and don't suffer the effects of exhaustion due to lack of rest, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Sentry's Rest
entries: When you take a long rest, you must spend at least six hours of it in an inactive, motionless state, rather than sleeping. In this state, you appear inert, but it doesn't render you unconscious, and you can see and hear as normal.

entries.name: Integrated Protection
entries: Your body has built-in protective layers, which determine your Armor Class. You gain no benefit from wearing armor, but if you are using a shield, you apply its bonus as normal.
You can alter your body to enter different defensive modes; each time you finish a long rest, choose one mode to adopt from the Integrated Protection table, provided you meet the mode's prerequisite.

entries.caption: Integrated protection
rows: 11 + your Dexterity modifier (add proficiency bonus if proficient with light armor)
13 + your Dexterity modifier (maximum of 2) + your proficiency bonus
16 + your proficiency bonus; disadvantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common.

entries.name: Specialized Design
entries: You gain one skill proficiency of your choice, one tool proficiency of your choice, and fluency in one language of your choice.

entries.name: Integrated Tool
entries: Choose one tool you're proficient with. This tool is integrated into your body, and you double your proficiency bonus for any ability checks you make with it. You must have your hands free to use this integrated tool.

entries.name: Envoys: Specialized Design
entries: As the name implies, most warforged were built to fight in the Last War. The vast majority of warforged are juggernauts or skirmishers—soldiers and scouts who fought under the banner of one of the Five Nations. Warforged envoys, however, were designed to perform other functions. As an envoy, you have a skill, a tool proficiency, and a tool that's part of your body. When you make an envoy character, consider the following questions: What is your purpose? How does your skill and your tool reflect that purpose? What form does your integrated tool take? If you have embedded thieves' tools, for instance, are your fingers actually lockpicks, or can you produce keys from various parts of your body? The following characters are examples of warforged with integrated tools.
{@b Lute} is a bard with the entertainer background; his namesake instrument folds out of his left arm.
{@b Compass Rose} is a wizard with the outlander background. A keen explorer, she uses her built-in {@item cartographer's tools|phb} to record the paths she travels.

{@b Masque} is an infiltrator. A rogue with the charlatan background and an integrated {@item disguise Kit|phb}, she was built to blend in and assassinate. Cannith built six warforged of her design, and Masque has vowed to hunt down and destroy the other five.

In developing your integrated tool, remember that you must have your hands free to use it. Masque, the infiltrator mentioned above, doesn't shapeshift like a changeling; she has to manually adjust her appearance.

entries.name: Iron Fists
entries: When you hit with an unarmed strike, you can deal 1d4 + your Strength modifier bludgeoning damage, instead of the normal damage for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Graceful
entries: You have proficiency with the {@skill Acrobatics} skill.

entries.name: Swift
entries: Your walking speed increases by 5 feet.

entries.name: Light Step
entries: When you are traveling alone for an extended period of time (one hour or more), you can move stealthily at a normal pace. (See {@book chapter 8|PHB|8|Travel Pace} of the Player's Handbook for information about travel pace.)

entries.name: 年齡
entries: Loxodons physically mature at the same rate as humans, but they live about 450 years. They highly value the weight of wisdom and experience and are considered young until they reach the age of 60.

entries.name: 陣營
entries: Most loxodons are lawful, believing in the value of a peaceful, ordered life. They also tend toward good.

entries.name: 體型
entries: Loxodons stand between 7 and 8 feet tall. Their massive bodies weigh between 300 and 400 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Loxodon Bravery
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: You have thick, leathery skin. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

entries.name: Tip: AC Calculations Don't Stack
entries: When the game gives you more than one way to calculate your Armor Class, you can use only one of them. You choose the one to use. For example, if you have the loxodon's Natural Armor trait and the monk's Unarmored Defense feature, you don't mix them together. Instead, you choose which one determines your AC.

entries.name: Mason's Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item mason's tools|phb}.

entries.name: Stonecunning
entries: Whenever you make an Intelligence ({@skill History}) check related to the origin of stonework, you are considered proficient in the {@skill History} skill and add double your normal proficiency bonus to the check, instead of your normal proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries: Thanks to your sensitive trunk, you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) and Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common.

entries.name: 年齡
entries: Hybrids begin their lives as adult humans, elves, or vedalken. They exhibit signs of slightly accelerated aging, so their maximum lifespans are probably reduced somewhat, but the Guardian Project has not been operating long enough to observe the full effect of this phenomenon.

entries.name: 陣營
entries: Most hybrids share the generally neutral outlook of the Simic Combine as a whole. They are more interested in scientific research and the standing of their guild than in moral or ethical questions. However, those who leave the Combine often do so because their philosophical outlook and alignment are more in line with a different guild's.

entries.name: 體型
entries: Your size is Medium, within the normal range of your humanoid base race.

entries.name: 黑暗視覺
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Animal Enhancement
entries: Your body has been altered to incorporate certain animal characteristics. You choose one animal enhancement now and a second enhancement at 5th level.
At 1st level, choose one of the following options:

items.name: Manta Glide
items.entry: Your ray-like wings can slow your fall and allow you to glide. When you fall and aren't incapacitated, you can subtract up to 100 feet from the fall when calculating falling damage, and you can move up to 2 feet horizontally for every 1 foot you descend.

items.name: Nimble Climber
items.entry: You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

items.name: Underwater Adaptation
items.entry: You can breathe air and water, and you have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

entries: At 5th level, choose one of the following options, or choose one of the options you didn't take at 1st level:

items.name: Grappling Appendage
items.entry: You have two special appendages growing alongside your arms. Choose whether they're both claws or tentacles. Each of these appendages is a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. Immediately after hitting, you can try to grapple the target as a bonus action. These appendages can't precisely manipulate anything and can't wield weapons, magic items, or other specialized equipment.

items.name: Carapace
items.entry: Your skin in places is covered by a thick shell. You gain a +1 bonus to AC when you're not wearing heavy armor.

items.name: Acid Spit
items.entry: As an action, you can spray a stream of acid from glands in your mouth, targeting one creature or object you can see within 30 feet of you. The target takes 2d10 acid damage unless it succeeds on a Dexterity saving throw against a DC equal to 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. This damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 11th level (3d10) and 17th level (4d10).

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common amd Elvish.

entries.name: 年齡
entries: Viashino mature quickly, reaching adulthood in their early teens. They live violent lives and rarely die of old age, but they would rarely live past 60 anyway.

entries.name: 陣營
entries: Viashino strongly tend toward chaotic alignments. They have no particular inclination toward good or evil.

entries.name: 體型
entries: Viashino are about as tall as humans, but they have lithe, wiry frames. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Bite
entries: Your fanged maw is a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal piercing damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Lashing Tail
entries: Your semi-prehensile tail is tipped with a bony blade. Immediately after a creature within 5 feet of you deals damage to you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to make an unarmed strike against that creature with your tail. If you hit, you deal slashing damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Wiry Frame
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Acrobatics} or the {@skill Stealth} skill (your choice).

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Draconic.

entries.name: 年齡
entries: 半人馬成年跟壽命的速度皆和人類差不多。

entries.name: 陣營
entries: 半人馬傾向中立。那些加入瑟雷尼亞的半人馬通常是中立善良，而那些加入古魯的半人馬則大多為混亂中立。

entries.name: 體型
entries: 半人馬站立的高度介於6呎到7呎之間，他們馬身的高度則約為4呎。你的體型為中型。

entries.name: 精類
entries: 你的生物類型是精類生物，而非類人生物。

entries.name: 衝鋒
entries: 若你朝著目標直線移動至少30呎並接著以近戰武器在同一回合命中它，你可以立刻在該攻擊後以一個附贈動作，使用你的馬蹄對目標進行一次攻擊。

entries.name: 馬蹄
entries: 你的馬蹄是天生近戰武器，你可以使用它們來進行徒手打擊。如果你以它們命中目標，則你造成等同1d4+你的力量調整值的鈍擊傷害，而不是一般徒手打擊的鈍擊傷害。

entries.name: 馬之身軀
entries: 當決定你的負重以及你可以拖曳或推動的重量時，你將你的體型視作比原本大一級。
此外，因為你的馬腿，任何需要手和腳的攀爬對你來說都特別困難。當你進行這攀爬時，每移動1呎都會額外消耗你4呎的移動速度，而非原本的額外1呎移動速度。

entries.name: 生存者
entries: 你熟練於以下其中一個你所選擇的技能{@skill 動物馴養}、{@skill 醫藥}、{@skill 自然}、或{@skill 生存}。

entries.name: 語言
entries: 你可以說、讀、寫通用語和木族語。木族語因為有著豐富的詞彙去描述自然現象跟精神力量，而在瑟雷尼亞中被廣泛地使用。

entries.name: 年齡
entries: 哥布林大約在八歲左右成年。他們的年紀成長明顯快於人類，且儘管很少能有哥布林活到老年，但最謹慎小心的哥布林也很少能活超過60歲。

entries.name: 陣營
entries: 大部分在拉尼卡的哥布林屬於混亂陣營，但並不特別偏向善良或邪惡。

entries.name: 體型
entries: 哥布林的身高介於3呎至4呎高，體重則介於40磅至80磅之間。你的體型為小型。

entries.name: 黑暗視覺
entries: 你在看距離你60呎範圍內的事物時，微光的照明程度對你而言視作明亮，黑暗則視作微光。你無法辨別黑暗中的顏色，而只能看到灰黑的輪廓。

entries.name: 小個子怒火
entries: 當你以一次攻擊或法術傷害了一個體型比你大的生物時，你可以讓該攻擊或法術對該生物造成額外的傷害。這個額外傷害等同於你的等級。一旦你使用此特性，直到你完成一次短休或長休之前都不能再使用它。

entries.name: 靈敏脫逃
entries: 你可以在每次你的回合以一個附贈動作來採取{@action 撤離}或{@action 躲藏}動作。

entries.name: 語言
entries: 你可以說、讀、寫通用語和哥布林語。在拉尼卡，哥布林語是一種辭彙有限、不固定文法的簡單語言，不適合用來進行複雜的對話。

entries.name: 年齡
entries: 象族生理成年的速度與人類相同，但他們的壽命可達大約450歲。他們非常重視智慧與經驗的重要性，且在達到60歲之前都被視為年輕人。

entries.name: 陣營
entries: 大多數的象族都是守序的，相信著和平與秩序生活的價值。他們也傾向善良。

entries.name: 體型
entries: 象族的身高介於7呎至8呎之間。他們龐大身軀的重量則介於300至400磅之間。你的體型為中型。

entries.name: 強健體格
entries: 當決定你的負重以及你可以拖曳、推動、或提舉的重量時，你將你的體型視作比原本大一級。

entries.name: 象族沉著
entries: 你在對抗{@condition 魅惑}或{@condition 恐懼}的豁免檢定中具有優勢。

entries.name: 天生護甲
entries: 你有著厚實、皮革般的肌膚。當你未穿著護甲的時候，你的AC為12+你的體質調整值。如果你穿著的護甲會讓有較低的AC，則你可以使用你的天生護甲來計算你的AC。當你使用天生護甲時，盾牌的加值仍會如常作用。

entries.name: 提示：AC的計算方法並不會累積
entries: 當遊戲機制給了你多於一種計算護甲等級的方式，你只能使用其中一種方式。由你選擇要使用哪一種。舉例來說，如果你同時擁有象族的天生護甲和武僧的無甲防禦，你不能把它們混在一起使用。你只能選擇其中一種方式來計算你的AC。

entries.name: 象鼻
entries: 你可以用你的象鼻抓取物品，你也可以把它作為呼吸管使用。它有著5呎觸及範圍，且它可以抬起等同你力量屬性值五倍的磅數。你可以用它做出以下的簡單作業：抬起、丟下、持握、推動或是拖動一個物體或生物；打開或關上一扇門或容器；擒抱某人；或進行一次徒手打擊。你的DM可能會允許你將其他的簡單作業加到上面的選項列表中。
你的象鼻不能使用武器、盾牌、或其他需要精細操作的東西，像是使用工具或魔法物品、或執行一個法術的姿勢構材。

entries.name: 敏銳嗅覺
entries: 多虧了你那敏銳的象鼻，你在牽涉到嗅覺的睿知({@skill 感知})、睿知({@skill 生存})、和智力({@skill 調查})檢定上具有優勢。

entries.name: 語言
entries: 你可以說、讀、寫通用語和象族語。
{@note 這些特性也同樣適用於在那些其他D&D世界中，沒有受到巴風特惡魔力量影響的米諾陶們。}
{@note 由於魔法風雲會的官方譯名將Minotaur譯為牛頭怪，因此以下內容都將以牛頭怪稱呼之。}

entries.name: 年齡
entries: 牛頭怪在17歲左右成年，且有最多150年的壽命。

entries.name: 陣營
entries: 大部分加入波洛斯的牛頭人傾向守序陣營，而那些與拉鐸司和古魯有關的牛頭人則傾向混亂陣營。

entries.name: 體型
entries: 牛頭怪的平均身高超過6呎，且他們有著健壯的身材。你的體型為中型。

entries.name: 牛角
entries: 你的牛角是天生近戰武器，你可以使用它們來進行徒手打擊。如果你以它們命中目標，則你造成等同1d6+你的力量調整值的穿刺傷害，而不是一般徒手打擊的鈍擊傷害。

entries.name: 牛角衝刺
entries: 緊接在你於你的回合使用{@action 疾走}動作並移動至少20呎後，你可以立刻以一個附贈動作使用你的牛角進行一次近戰攻擊。

entries.name: 猛捶角擊
entries: 緊接在你於你的回合以{@action 攻擊}動作的一部分，透過一次近戰攻擊命中一個生物後，你可以立刻以一個附贈動作嘗試使用你的牛角去推撞該目標。目標的體型不能比你大超過一級，且必須距離你5呎以內。除非它成功通過DC等同於8+你的熟練加值+你的力量調整值的力量豁免，否則你將把它推離你最多10呎。

entries.name: 威風凜凜
entries: 你熟練於以下其中一個你所選擇的技能：{@skill 威嚇}或{@skill 說服}。

entries.name: 語言
entries: 你可以說、讀、寫通用語和牛頭語。

entries.name: 年齡
entries: 混合體一出生就是個成年的人類、精靈、或維多肯。他們已稍快的速度老化，因此他們的最大壽命可能會有所減少。守護者計畫執行的時間長度尚不足以觀察這個現象對混合體的整體影響。

entries.name: 陣營
entries: 大部分的混合體都跟析米克聯合有著相同的中立觀點。他們對科學研究和公會地位的興致遠高於道德倫理問題。然而，那些離開聯合的混合體通常是因為他們的哲學觀與其他公會更為一致。

entries.name: 體型
entries: 你的體型為中型，你的身高體重都落在作為你基底的類人種族的正常範圍內。

entries.name: 黑暗視覺
entries: 你在看距離你60呎範圍內的事物時，微光的照明程度對你而言視作明亮，黑暗則視作微光。你無法辨別黑暗中的顏色，而只能看到灰黑的輪廓。

entries.name: 語言
entries: 你可以說、讀、寫通用語和精靈語或維多肯語。

entries.name: 動物改造
entries: 你的身體已經被改造成包含某些動物的特徵。你在現在選擇一項動物改造，並在到達5級時選擇第二項。
在1級時，從下列選項中選擇一項：

items.name: 蝠鱝滑翼
items.entry: 你擁有如鰩類般的魚鰭，讓你可以將它們作為翅膀以減緩墜落速度或讓你得以滑翔。當你墜落且並未{@condition 無力}時，你可以在計算墜落傷害時減去100呎的墜落高度，且每下降1呎，都可以讓你水平移動最多2呎。

items.name: 靈敏攀爬者
items.entry: 你擁有等同於你步行速度的攀爬速度。

items.name: 水中適應
items.entry: 你可以在水下呼吸，且你擁有等同於你步行速度的游泳速度。

entries: 在5級時，你的身體進一步進化，發展出新的特徵。選擇一項你在1級時沒有選擇的選項，或從下列選項中選擇一項：

items.name: 格鬥附肢
items.entry: 在你的雙臂旁長出了兩個特殊的附肢。決定它們是爪子還是觸手。以一個動作，你可以使用它們其中之一去嘗試擒抱一個生物。它們兩個都是天生武器，你可以使用它們來進行徒手打擊。如果你以它命中目標，目標將受到等同1d6+你的力量調整值的鈍擊傷害，而不是一般徒手打擊的鈍擊傷害。緊接在命中之後，你可以嘗試以一個附贈動作對目標進行擒抱。這些附肢不能精準的操作任何東西，也不能使用武器、魔法物品、或其它專門的裝備。

items.name: 甲殼
items.entry: 你的肌膚各處覆蓋著厚重的甲殼。當你沒有穿著重甲時，你的AC獲得+1加值。

items.name: 酸液噴射
items.entry: 以一個動作，你可以從你嘴裡的腺體對一個距離你30呎內且你所能看見的生物或物體噴出酸液。除非目標成功通過一次DC等同於8+你的體質調整值+你的熟練加值的敏捷豁免，否則它將受到{@dice 2D10}酸蝕傷害。這個傷害將在你的等級升至11級時增加至{@dice 3d10}，17級時{@dice 4d10}。你可以使用這項特性的次數等同於你的體質調整值(最少一次)，且你在完成一次長休後恢復所有已使用的次數。

entries.name: 年齡
entries: 維多肯的成長比人類來的緩慢，大約在40歲左右成年。他們的壽命通常是350歲，但有些人可以活到500歲。

entries.name: 陣營
entries: 維多肯通常是守序且非邪惡的。

entries.name: 體型
entries: 高且纖瘦，維多肯的身高平均介於6至6½呎之間，且體重通常少於200磅。你的體型為中型。

entries.name: 維多肯式沉著
entries: 你在所有智力、睿知、和魅力的豁免檢定上具有優勢。

entries.name: 孜孜不倦的專家
entries: 你熟練於以下其中一個你所選擇的技能：{@skill 奧秘}、{@skill 歷史}、{@skill 調查}、{@skill 醫藥}、{@skill 表演}、或{@skill 手上把戲}。你也熟練於一個你所選擇的工具。
每當你進行一次使用所選的工具或技能的屬性檢定時，骰一顆D4，並將骰出來的數字加到該檢定的總和中。

entries.name: 部分兩棲
entries: 藉由透過你的肌膚吸收氧氣，你可以在水下呼吸長達1小時。一旦你到達這個極限，直到你完成一次長休之前都不能再使用這個能力。

entries.name: 語言
entries: 你可以說、讀、寫通用語、維多肯語、和另一種你所選擇的語言。
